An adaptable and responsible graduate passionated about computer software development. Throughout my career I successfully combined my studies with work and other commitments showing myself to be self-motivated, organized and capable of working under pressure. I have a clear, logical mind with a practical approach to problem solving and a drive to see things through to completion. I
enjoy working on my own initiative or in a team. In short, I am reliable, trustworthy, hardworking and eager to learn.

I use to read articles related to Front end/Back end new web technologies to keep my knowledge up to date. I am working on a personal Software products as a hobby. I like to travel whenever I can. hang out with friends and of course to eat and drink :D

projects.description:
Easy way to Health
Apr 2016 – Present

Project descriptionEasy Way to Health changes the way people weigh themselves and interact with scales. We developed a proprietary, patent pending weight management system that receives weight measurements from Wi-Fi scales, allowing us to translate individual’s natural weight fluctuation into a trend. Our interface uses a speedometer type gauge (Change-o-meter™) that anticipates weight trend changes two weeks in advance helping our users understand and control their weight. Because our scales do not display weight readout numbers and we treat weight as a trend, our solution is proving to reduce people’s frustration with scales, which in turn makes self-weighing a more motivational and effective process: more people will achieve more sustainable weight loss. 

Tech stack: CakePHP 2x, MySQL, Bootstrap, Jquery, Android, Objective C, REST API, High ChartsiBooking | www.ibooking.lk

He is passionate about his work and always seems to have great awareness of new creative strategies and technology.

projects.description:
Projects

Project nameTravelSL - A Context Aware and Personalised Travel Recommendation System
Aug 2016 – Jun 2017

Project descriptionAs Sri Lanka accommodates many tourist attractions with diverse features of interest, the requirement for an application that enables tourists to filter attractions based on personal preference is apparent. “TravelSL” is a mobile application which assists tourists in traveling to places of their personal preference in Sri Lanka. 

The app requires a user to login via a Facebook account to identify the personal travel preferences of the user. Upon registration, a one-time sentiment analysis of posted “check-ins” of the user will be conducted which derives an explicit rating for each location visited by the user, to identify the user’s travel preferences. 

Based on the identified preferences, unvisited locations in any city in Sri Lanka can be rated by a state-of-the-art recommender implementing a user-based collaborating filtering technique. The uniqueness of the solution rests in the use of social media data available on Facebook to identify user preferences and the logic of the recommendation system which can robustly handle the cold start problems. 

“TravelSL” is extremely user-friendly as it then designs an optimum route covering top recommended locations based on the traveling mode, distance, predicted rating and existing reservations for each location made visible to the user on Google Maps.

Technologies Used: Python 3.x, Mongo DB, Android StudioEmbla Sphere - HR Portal

This is an HR Management system which basically helps to record the information of employees and allowing to see their average working hours, late attendance, remaining and taken leaves and missed punch records. Apart from that, this system facilitates the employees to apply leaves based on their allocations. 

Technologies used: Angular 1.x, Web API2, SQL Server Management Studio, Repository Design Pattern, Unit of work

projects.description:
Sign Language Converter - Research Project
May 2017 – May 2018

Project descriptionThough communication is a necessity of the human being there has not been found a better solution to remove the communication gap between normal and deaf people for Sinhala language. Therefore, in this dissertation, our aim was to propose a system which facilitate the communication between normal and deaf people. Same problem has been addressed by using different techniques in different approaches, but they are for facilitating languages other than Sinhala language. To implement our proposed system, leap motion controller, image processing techniques, NLP module, Weka tool and Festival framework has been selected as technologies. In our design part four main individual research parts are included as identifying hand gesture using leap motion, identifying hand using image processing, feature vector creation using image processing and recognize the sign, convert output text to audio. As per the implementation we did, it obtained higher accuracy in recognizing the sign. But there were several limitations in identifying sign as the system was implemented only for recognizing static signs, the accuracy of the system strongly effects on the illumination and brightness of the environment. Our hope is to improve this system to succeed in recognizing dynamic signs as well.Tour Guider – Web based Application System
Jul 2016

That packages are automatically generate by the system which are satisfy the user’s preferences. And also the selected package gives details about what are the places the user can stay. It includes route direction, hotels, resort, rest houses and details about that place.

A six month internship. The company was developing a Robotic ATM which allows the users to communicate withe system using speech. The system allows the user to perform financial transactions. 

As a part of the project, I Implemented  a phoneme recognizer that recognizes phonemes from speech in real time. I worked on Improving text to speech for Tamil and Sinhala. projects.description:
News Analyzer
Oct 2016 – Present

Project description"News Analyzer"​ is my level 4 research project that analyze the online news articles to predict there popularity. This project is an ongoing project and it is going to implement as 6 modules as following manner. This system has two roles as "News Publishers"​ and "Readers"​.
1. Popularity predicting module 
2. Publisher area recommendation area
3. Comment Analyzing area
4. Article Content Summary module 
5. Reader article recommended module 
6. Article Tracking module 
Among them 3 & 4 are modules which I am contributing my knowledge. They can describe as following manner. 
Comment Analyzing area (Publisher side) - By this module analyze the comments which has obtained by a particular article and give a comment summary for the publisher to get an idea about his or her article. This module is my contribution for this project. In here I am using Microsoft Neural Network Algorithm to train the data set. As the input I choose article title, comments, comment id(for tracking), rating value. As the out put use rating value. Here assumption is usually people comment their article by rating it. normally give high rate for good comment and low rate bad comment. Then the hidden layer train the data set by using them. After that by using DMX query we will able to predict the rate of a particular given comment. As this way I can categorize high rated comments and low rated comments. Then that result goes to text summarizing module and create a summary for both high and low rated comments. That is good for a news publisher to get an idea about, how their readers think about the articles as well as reliability of articles also able to can obtain. 

Article Content Summary module (Reader Side) - This is my next module which I contribute my knowledge to this project. It creates a summary of recommended article list content. Here happen multiple text summarizing, as my approach, I am going to use TF*IDF graph based approach and NLP knowledge to create the summary.Sayanu Service Management Tool - S2MT

Project descriptionFor many deaf people, sign language is the principle means of communication. This increases the isolation of hearing impaired people. This paper presents a system prototype that is able to automatically recognize sign language to help normal people to communicate more effectively with the hearing or speech impaired people. The Sign to Voice system prototype was developed using Feed Forward Neural Network and the gesture input device was a designed sensor glove. This system recognizes both static and dynamic gestures of American Sign Language including the alphabet and a subset of its words, phrases and sentences. Recognized gestures are translated into voice in real time and the voice input is modeled using a 3D model for the recognition of the signer.

recommendations.description:
I worked with Saumini on several app development projects. While her forte was in backend development using PHP, given the current situation at the time, Saumini was required to also make fixes and adjustment on the front-end due to some last minute client changes. She on her own initiative learned up both html and CSS, and helped deliver the final product on time. Saumini has also shown much interest in learning new frameworks and platform. She is definitely a positive addition to any development team and I look forward to be able to work with her again in the future.
I had the pleasure of working with Saumini for over 3 years during our tenure at Vocanic. Saumini is a quick learner and an extremely smart engineer. I found her to be very dependable and a real asset to the team. I'd gladly work with Saumini again in the future!
Saumini was one the most dependable engineers I have hired or managed. She is extremely good at analytical thinking and being able to troubleshoot tough problems to resolutions. Combined with a capability to deliver projects from scratch to a timeline, Saumini becomes an extremely valuable member of any engineering team. Saumini started at Vocanic delivering custom built apps for clients, after which she worked on VSocial product line, both on frontend and backend. general.description:
I have always been interested in making things. When I was 13 I dismantled my first TV game to remove an irritating speaker. Equipped only with a plier and a Phillips screwdriver,  needless to say, it didn’t end well for me. Today my fortunes are much better. I’d fixed a TV, computers/laptops and even ventured in to restoring old equipment and repairing cars. But I am best building complex web applications for medium to large scale organizations.

For the last 6 years I have been functioning as a freelance developer available through UpWork. In that time I have worked with established companies, startups and individuals numbering a total of 48 contracts with 100% client satisfaction. Today I develop GivingFire and I love working there. Previously I have had the pleasure to be part of the Orpiva and TextbookValet team.

I am also in the process of starting up a web based startup. I have some ideas that have not been pursued by others. I am spending my free time building the underlying infrastructure for those projects.

Professionally speaking, I can be identified as a full stack Ruby developer. Most of my portfolio is based on Ruby on Rails.

Technologies:

Server side: Ruby, Node, PHP, Python
Client side: HTML5, CSS3, jQuery, JavaScript, React, Require.js
Database: PostgreSQL, MySQL, Redis
System administration: Linux and BSD

If you would like to connect, feel free to write to me. I will respond as soon as I am free.

projects.description:
Project nameSETrans - English to Sinhalese Translator
Nov 2011 – Apr 2012

Project descriptionRe implementation of the EngSin Project using Java with optimized algorithms and data structures achieving relative translation speeds no less than 20X.

The new implementation is with the ability to handle a wider set of language as per the use of the Stanford Language Parser for the decoding of the language. It also involves 1st Order Logic to obtain a written Sinhalese output. Statistical methods were implemented to resolve ambiguity. 

The implementation which involves AI techniques was also attempt to resolve information loss using software agents but the method was proved not very successful.

Other creator
Pramod Herath
Project nameEngSin Translator
Sep 2010 – Nov 2011

Project descriptionEngSin Translator is a rule based machine translator built as an exhibit of EngEx 2010 exhibition. The project is aimed at reducing the language barrier especially when it comes to using the internet.

The tool comprises of a language decoding unit that understands language structure of basic English sentences. It the does necessary transformations to suit the destination language (Sinhalese) and finally translates using a bilingual dictionary.

The project served as the foundation the ground research for the SETrans Project which was done in the final year.
Other creators
Pramod Herath Pasindu Ariyarathna
Project nameLive Streaming Service
Oct 2011

Project descriptionImplementation of a local video streaming service using Microsoft IIS Live Smooth Streaming and Microsoft Expression encoder.

The tools were favored over other available tools considering cost and ease to deploy in a small period of time. IIS Live Smooth Streaming which delivers content at bit rates appropriate for the client meant smooth viewing and saving of bandwidth.

Project nameServer Upgrade & Back Up Server Creation
Apr 2011 – Jul 2011

Project descriptionTo research and gain technical know how to update existing out dated server applications and Linux/BSD based systems to there latest stable versions.

It involved implementing existing Asterisk VOIP servers, Mail Server, LDAP server, Web Server, Proxy Server on latest version of BSD (or some in BSD Jail environments) in VMWare based virtual servers.

The custom billing module at the Asterisk servers were found not directly portable to the latest version and the use of A2Billing or cusom made module as per new API was suggested.

Project nameImplementation of Cacti Network Monitoring Tool
Jun 2011

Project descriptionAs per the heavy but unexplained use of network bandwidth a network bandwidth monitoring tool was requested to be deployed. After a brief research Cacti was selected due to its informative graphs and deployed in a local server.

The project which monitored an excessive of 120 switches was used to send requests to entities to reduce unnecessary downloads.

A basic informative video was released to YouTube. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zQmE4IwNVvo

projects.description:
SafePay
May 2015

Project descriptionSafePay is a project that is to maximize the security of credit/debit cards. Simply a customer can link his/her credit card to his/her phone, so that customer can send an USSD request to activate the card from his mobile phone, before purchasing and that activation will be last for several minutes (5 minutes). After that period of time card goes to deactivated mode and no transactions can be done without activating the card again.

It is a big issue that any third party person can use any ones credit/debit card very easily without any authentication (eg: at super markets, fuel stations...). So this project ensures the security of Credit/Debit cards.

This project was done for the TadHack 2015

projects.description:
Enhancing Trinity Platoform for Handlin High Volume DeNovo Transcriptome Assembly
Mar 2016 – Present

Project descriptionThis is our final year research project, which is on bioinformatics. TRINITY is a set of software tools to assemble transcriptomes for using various fields including health care industry, agricultural industry, etc. Problem in most of these assemblers is that they use high usage of memory and they fails to provide accurate results with high volumes of input data.
This project aims to overcome these problems by using replications of data and try to figure out the acceptable size of input data and to optimize it to handle high volumes of data with low resource usage.

Project namePatient Matching 2.0 - Incremental Patient Matching
May 2017 – Sep 2017

Project descriptionPatient Matching Module is an application where it tries to identify records that belong to the same patient among different number of data sources. This module is significant because in real world it has to be dealt with erroneous data.
Incremental patient matching is a method of identifying duplicate patients very efficiently. 
In a real world scenario, the requirement would be to match thousands of patients with each other. Once this matching process continues it would be very time consuming since all of the patients are compared with each of them regardless of the fact that two or three new patients are added/updated.

This was my GSoC project where I had to bring a mechanism to match patients incrementally and I did complete it successfully.

projects.description:
Sports Analysis Using Video Tracking
Apr 2015

Project descriptionThe proposed system analyzes sports videos by implementing a robust object tracking
algorithm. Computational complexity of this algorithm is minimal compared to most of
the existing algorithms for tracking objects. Hence the system is able to track the objects
accurately and efficiently.

This is a marker less approach; therefore the main drawback of the prevailing systems is addressed. A video feed taken from a single camera is used to provide relevant
statistics and a 3D reconstruction of the game. Creation of a 3D reconstruction ("Hawk
Eye") using a single video feed is an integral part of this project. A novel algorithm developed to enable this feature and the algorithm also addresses the theoretical problem of perceiving depth using a single viewpoint. This project proposes a method to accurately calculate the 3D location of the ball using a single video feed and details about the standard tennis court in unison. Furthermore
the approach used in the project can be extended to analyze other sports which involve standard courts.

Other creators
Rajith Roshan Chamika Nugegoda Lilantha Nawagamuwa
